intro: Vappodes affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf vappodes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Vappodes affinis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
